page.title: 18Bus, Car or Bicycle.
page.content: Some of the properties in the locality are quite isolated and some means of transport is essential. There is a local bus service, which operates on a circular route to Ledbury twice a week. A bus service operates from Ledbury to Gloucester along the A 417 once a week, but villagers have to walk some distance to the main road to the nearest stop. Most families have at least one car, however, some older people still prefer to use bicycles or walk. The farmers use Landrovers or other four wheel drive vehicles as the roads are treacherous during the winter months. The children travel to school on buses or taxis, only five children walk to the local school. There is a Dial-a-Ride bus available for the old and the handicapped, to enable them to obtain their shopping.
